page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT AROUND PRIVETT
page.content: Since farming is much less labour intensive than it used to be, fewer of the families living in the Privett area are connected with the farms. Many commute daily to the nearby towns and even as far as London. Cottages which, only a few years ago, were occupied by farmworkers' families are now let to retired farmworkers and private families. Apart from the farmers' sons few of the young people choose to work on the land when they leave school and travel into the nearby towns for employment. During the summer holidays the older boys may help with the harvest, often carting and stacking straw bales. Farmworkers get a free cottage, some a milk allow- ance and firewood. They work a basic 40 hour week and overtime with 4 weeks holiday. They work long days including weekends in Summer.
